summary:
=== Purchase Information === Product Title: Doc Martin Special Collection: Series 1-5 plus the Movies Review Date: 2015/01/24 Store: Clunes, Martin (Actor), Catz, Caroline (Actor), Ferguson, Craig (Director) & 0 more Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy Product Description: ['“Sweet, stirring, and completely addictive” ––', 'Slate', '“Delightfully quirky” —', 'Los Angeles Times', 'He’s surly, tactless, self-centered, and uptight—but he’s the only doctor in town. Relocating to the picturesque village of Portwenn is not what this doctor ordered. After developing a crippling fear of blood, hotshot London surgeon Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes,', 'Men Behaving Badly', ') reluctantly retrains as a GP and opens a practice in the quirky seaside town, where he quickly offends the villagers with his dour and dismissive bedside manner. In these five complete series, Doc Martin catches the eye of the most beautiful woman in Portwenn (Caroline Catz,', 'Murder in Suburbia', '), tests the patience of his long-suffering aunt (Stephanie Cole,', 'Tenko', '), and repeatedly hurts feelings as he heals bodies. The two feature-length movies reveal the character’s first incarnation as Dr. Martin Bamford. He’s still ornery but less socially inept, an obstetrician fleeing to the coastal village to reassess his marriage and career. Martin Clunes delivers an uproarious lead performance, aided by outstanding supporting casts, in this award-winning fish-out-of-water comedy.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Box set, Widescreen, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color', 'Contributor': 'Absolom, Joe, Clunes, Martin, Catz, Caroline, McNeice, Ian, Ferguson, Craig', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '13', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '5.5 x 3.6 x 7.7 inches; 15.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '21388', 'Director': 'Ferguson, Craig', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Widescreen, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color', 'Run time': '32 hours and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 7, 2013', 'Actors': 'Clunes, Martin, Catz, Caroline, McNeice, Ian, Absolom, Joe', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '13'} Review Text: I really love this series..
It is funny, the timing is great.
Well written and boy, I want to live in a village like Portwenn.

The only criticism I have as I move through this series is more on the portrayal of alternative medicine. Obviously Doc Martin is strickly Left brain my way or the highway medical science is best. And the series generally portrays any alternative more natural theories as utterly quackish I feel that I had to say something because in all honesty I do not feel that natural alternative medicine is portrayed very fairly. It is completely maligned and mocked while Doc Ellingham is generally won out to be right all the time.

I just wanted folks to know that this is not exacty a balanced portrayal. Yes, some alternative theories can be take to extreme.. but so can very left brain approaches in medicine and science.

For example.. overuse of antibiotics. Antibiotics are useful but overprescribed generally by doctors for everything. He is somewhat more mannered that Edith... his ex.. who is VERY elitist.

Anyway.. that is my 2 cents Review Title: I really love this series Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/10/02 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Grant Baldwin'], 'Producers': ['Jenny Rustemeyer'], 'Starring': ['Jonathan Bloom', 'Tristram Stuart', 'Dana Gunders']} Review Text: This is a MUST WATCH Documentary!. I have been wanting to see this for a while now because I know it is a horrendous issue. Furthermore, I know I am IMMENSELY GUILTY for wasting food.

I am striving to change my ways and save $$ on food, on working not to waste so much food and to help bring awareness to this issue.

I know "shaming" folks is frowned upon.. but maybe this is something we should shame . People are supposidly going hungry and the question is WHY?

It is our perceptions of food. Those perceptions are cultivated by the ADVERTISING industry and so I think they need to do a lot more to focus on this. I think fast food companies, and markets and anyone that produces food needs to take responsibility for and UNDO the damage they have done.! Review Title: MUST WATCH DOCUMENTARY. !!!! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Product Title: Planet X Nibiru and the Anunnaki Review Date: 2017/06/04 Categories: Special Interest Product Description: ['Lloyd Pye reveals information regarding the genetic manipulation of the human species by an alien race from another planet. This planet is said to have a 3,600 year elliptical orbit which may currently be approaching our solar system. Is Planet X Nibiru inhabited and inbound?'] Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Robert Sepehr'], 'Producers': ['Robert Sepehr'], 'Starring': ['LloydPye']} Review Text: It's not the content that I have an issue with but all this video is is a boring interview with Lloyd Pie
I thought I was getting a documentary but all it is is this guy talking.

Not worth 2 dollars.. not worth one..

Be warned this is not a documentary but a boring interview. This could have just been uploaded to You Tube .. Review Title: Just a boring interview.. Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/11/05 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Lowery'], 'Producers': ['Toby Halbrooks', 'James M. Johnston', 'Adam Donaghey'], 'Starring': ['Casey Affleck', 'Rooney Mara'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']} Review Text: I hate reading any reviews before I watch a film. It is hard not to though.
No, this isn't a "scary" Halloween movie , but it is about a ghost. It is about a lot more.
It is meditative. If you are in for an action flick. This isn't it.

But it is VERY good. Give it a chance. If you are in a calm, meditative and contemplative space this is for you. Open yourself up to the quiet of this film.

I won't give the plot away. It is more about feeling and thinking and being and not being.. that is all I will say.

Peace Review Title: A very good, meditative and contemplative movie and that is a GOOD thing. Very recommended. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/01/27 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Dean Devlin'], 'Producers': ['Dean Devlin', 'David Ellison', 'Dana Goldberg', 'Marc Roskin', 'Don Granger', 'Herbert W. Gains'], 'Starring': ['Gerard Butler', 'Jim Sturgess', 'Abbie Cornish'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: The special effects and script are cheesy and sloppy. I guess I should have known better.
I hate when they make disaster special effects that are utterly ridiculous and over the top. They ruin the movies.
It could have been a 1/2way decent flick if they made it more "realistic" . Got rid of the tropish characters and had a better script. Review Title: I guess I should have known better. I hate when they make disaster special effects ... Rating: 2.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/01/29 Average Rating: 4.0 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['None available'], 'Directors': ['Florian Habicht'], 'Starring': ['Claudia Aiono', 'Huia Apiata', 'Barbara Armstrong'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} Review Text: This is actually really good documentary. The makeup is great and the interviews are more than just about the "spook house". There are real people who talk deeper about the psychology of this site and their own personal history and what got them into doing this work. Nicely filmed. Interesting to have a different cultural take on Horror houses. Review Title: Very Good! Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2018/05/20 Average Rating: 4.9 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Adrian Molina', 'Lee Unkrich'], 'Producers': ['Darla K. Anderson'], 'Starring': ['Anthony Gonzalez', 'Gael García Bernal', 'Benjamin Bratt'], 'Studio': ['Pixar']} Review Text: Ok, this movie made me cry...
I am big into Geneology and I used to always have an ancestor altar... and I need to put one up again. Review Title: Made me cry... in a good way. Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2019/01/26 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'substance use', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Juan Carlos Medina', 'Alice Troughton', 'Sarah Walker'], 'Producers': ['Deborah Harkness', 'Lachlan MacKinnon'], 'Starring': ['Matthew Goode', 'Teresa Palmer', 'Valarie Pettiford']} Review Text: I have read all the books and this adaption is excellent. Very well done.

Nuff said Review Title: EXCELLENT!!! Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/03/26 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kevin Costner', 'Curtis Crawford', 'Curt Truninger'], 'Producers': ['Jim Wilson', 'Steve Tisch', 'Kevin Costner'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Costner', 'Will Patton', 'Larenz Tate'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: Watching it cause I was in a bit of an end of the world mood and needed some hope Review Title: Better than I thought, I actually teared up a few times Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/02/21 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vivien Lesnik Weisman'], 'Producers': ['Vivien Lesnik Weisman'], 'Starring': ['Barrett Brown', 'Jeremy Hammond'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} Review Text: Important to watch in retrospect of the Trump debacle and the QAnon disinformation/psychological campaign!
If you want to understand why Trump was elected and why QAnon and Flat earth came into being? It was in reaction to the fact that folks who were dedicated to uncovering the Truth were getting too powerful. The only way to bring the Truth movement down was to poison the well and create a fake disinfo campaign to discredit the entire REAL Truth movement.. Review Title: important to watch Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/07/23 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Directors': ['Julie Taymor'], 'Producers': ['Julie Taymor', 'Lynn Hendee'], 'Starring': ['Julianne Moore', 'Alicia Vikander', 'Timothy Hutton'], 'Studio': ['Roadside Attractions']} Review Text: I will admit, that being born in 1968 to a strong mother who was just 2-3 months older than Gloria Steinem I might be accused for taking too much for granted.

My mother got married in 1966 .. but she was already a doctor and had gone to Medical school in the 1950s when most women were becoming homemakers!. The youngest of 3, her father encouraged her to go into medicine, not nursing , like her older sister. My parents divorced in 1977 (and my father, despite his own weaknesses was a nice good man). My mother ended up raising me by herself. I had my own personal struggles growing up but feeling inferior to a boy or a man was not one of them. Both my parents loved me and gave me all they could. I didn't really identify with the "Feminist" struggle although I appreciated it intellectually. I was active in the Pro Choice movement as a right for women to control their own bodies. However, it was the more militant feminism of the 90s that unfortunately turned me away from the Feminist movement and I felt that a lot of the issues got lost among fighting over political correct speech, endlessly talking about how men are evil patriarchal rapists... So.. it was nice to return to the context on which the real women's struggle was about.

It is hard to sympathise with a woman in the United states that generally (generally) has it easy.. while in places like India... women are STILL struggling for basic dignity and respect.. Or in Afganistan where the Taliban is coming back into power to oppress once again.. or in Saudi Arabia .... and while yes, the United States is losing the battle with the Pro Choice movement..... I fear it is because women in the US have lost the path... fighting over silly things rather than critically important ones... Unfortunately it is about "branding your message" sorry to say that..

I don't demonize women who wanted to be homemakers. I think opportunties should be available for all women.. but that includes NOT being expected to take on big roles just because people like Gloria fought for that.. it wasn't JUST so all girls would desire to be president but they would also have the dignity of staying at home and raising children if that is their CHOICE... again.. it is about CHOICE and about our personal awareness of what we want, the realities of what is biologically available... as sucky that may be...

Overall, very enjoyable and inspiring. Review Title: Nice review of the woman's movement Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/08/17 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Patterson'], 'Producers': ['Adam Dietrich', 'Melissa Kirkendall', 'James Montague'], 'Starring': ['Sierra McCormick', 'Jake Horowitz', 'Gail Cronauer'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: I love this.
This film really transports you to the 1950s. Not in that flashy stereotyped way, but as though you really existed in some small town 1950s era town.
It is an intimate film.. Like something you would tell around a campfire...
The film really captures the atmosphere and ambience of the town and the era....
Reminds me of driving in a car late at night and you are listening to COAST to COAST radio.. or sitting in your bed late at night listening to the radio....

Love it. More of this kind of filmmaking please.. less over the top "special effects" that get so boring..

Great movie. Review Title: Really draws you in..... Rating: 5.0 --------------------------------------------------

prompt:
Based on the provided purchase history, generate three separate summaries focusing on different aspects of the user's experiences. Each summary should be under 256 words. Focus only on keywords and clear trends supported by multiple interactions. Do not repeat specific product names or details. avoid repeating product names, specifications, or technical details: 1. POSITIVE: Describe only the positive experiences and what was liked. 2. NEGATIVE: Describe only the negative experiences and what was disliked. 3. OVERALL: Provide a overall summary including both positive and negative aspects. Here's the purchase data: === Purchase Information === Product Title: Doc Martin Special Collection: Series 1-5 plus the Movies Review Date: 2015/01/24 Store: Clunes, Martin (Actor), Catz, Caroline (Actor), Ferguson, Craig (Director) & 0 more Format: DVD Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy Product Description: ['“Sweet, stirring, and completely addictive” ––', 'Slate', '“Delightfully quirky” —', 'Los Angeles Times', 'He’s surly, tactless, self-centered, and uptight—but he’s the only doctor in town. Relocating to the picturesque village of Portwenn is not what this doctor ordered. After developing a crippling fear of blood, hotshot London surgeon Martin Ellingham (Martin Clunes,', 'Men Behaving Badly', ') reluctantly retrains as a GP and opens a practice in the quirky seaside town, where he quickly offends the villagers with his dour and dismissive bedside manner. In these five complete series, Doc Martin catches the eye of the most beautiful woman in Portwenn (Caroline Catz,', 'Murder in Suburbia', '), tests the patience of his long-suffering aunt (Stephanie Cole,', 'Tenko', '), and repeatedly hurts feelings as he heals bodies. The two feature-length movies reveal the character’s first incarnation as Dr. Martin Bamford. He’s still ornery but less socially inept, an obstetrician fleeing to the coastal village to reassess his marriage and career. Martin Clunes delivers an uproarious lead performance, aided by outstanding supporting casts, in this award-winning fish-out-of-water comedy.'] Average Rating: 4.8 Product Details: {'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Box set, Widescreen, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color', 'Contributor': 'Absolom, Joe, Clunes, Martin, Catz, Caroline, McNeice, Ian, Ferguson, Craig', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '13', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'Product Dimensions': '5.5 x 3.6 x 7.7 inches; 15.2 Ounces', 'Item model number': '21388', 'Director': 'Ferguson, Craig', 'Media Format': 'Box set, Widescreen, Multiple Formats, NTSC, Color', 'Run time': '32 hours and 45 minutes', 'Release date': 'May 7, 2013', 'Actors': 'Clunes, Martin, Catz, Caroline, McNeice, Ian, Absolom, Joe', 'Studio': 'ACORN MEDIA', 'Number of discs': '13'} Review Text: I really love this series..
It is funny, the timing is great.
Well written and boy, I want to live in a village like Portwenn.

The only criticism I have as I move through this series is more on the portrayal of alternative medicine. Obviously Doc Martin is strickly Left brain my way or the highway medical science is best. And the series generally portrays any alternative more natural theories as utterly quackish I feel that I had to say something because in all honesty I do not feel that natural alternative medicine is portrayed very fairly. It is completely maligned and mocked while Doc Ellingham is generally won out to be right all the time.

I just wanted folks to know that this is not exacty a balanced portrayal. Yes, some alternative theories can be take to extreme.. but so can very left brain approaches in medicine and science.

For example.. overuse of antibiotics. Antibiotics are useful but overprescribed generally by doctors for everything. He is somewhat more mannered that Edith... his ex.. who is VERY elitist.

Anyway.. that is my 2 cents Review Title: I really love this series Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2016/10/02 Average Rating: 4.4 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Grant Baldwin'], 'Producers': ['Jenny Rustemeyer'], 'Starring': ['Jonathan Bloom', 'Tristram Stuart', 'Dana Gunders']} Review Text: This is a MUST WATCH Documentary!. I have been wanting to see this for a while now because I know it is a horrendous issue. Furthermore, I know I am IMMENSELY GUILTY for wasting food.

I am striving to change my ways and save $$ on food, on working not to waste so much food and to help bring awareness to this issue.

I know "shaming" folks is frowned upon.. but maybe this is something we should shame . People are supposidly going hungry and the question is WHY?

It is our perceptions of food. Those perceptions are cultivated by the ADVERTISING industry and so I think they need to do a lot more to focus on this. I think fast food companies, and markets and anyone that produces food needs to take responsibility for and UNDO the damage they have done.! Review Title: MUST WATCH DOCUMENTARY. !!!! Rating: 1.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2017/11/05 Average Rating: 4.2 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'alcohol use', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['David Lowery'], 'Producers': ['Toby Halbrooks', 'James M. Johnston', 'Adam Donaghey'], 'Starring': ['Casey Affleck', 'Rooney Mara'], 'Studio': ['A24 Distribution LLC']} Review Text: I hate reading any reviews before I watch a film. It is hard not to though.
No, this isn't a "scary" Halloween movie , but it is about a ghost. It is about a lot more.
It is meditative. If you are in for an action flick. This isn't it.

But it is VERY good. Give it a chance. If you are in a calm, meditative and contemplative space this is for you. Open yourself up to the quiet of this film.

I won't give the plot away. It is more about feeling and thinking and being and not being.. that is all I will say.

Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2020/03/26 Average Rating: 4.7 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English', 'English [Audio Description]'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Kevin Costner', 'Curtis Crawford', 'Curt Truninger'], 'Producers': ['Jim Wilson', 'Steve Tisch', 'Kevin Costner'], 'Starring': ['Kevin Costner', 'Will Patton', 'Larenz Tate'], 'Studio': ['WARNER BROS.']} Review Text: Watching it cause I was in a bit of an end of the world mood and needed some hope Review Title: Better than I thought, I actually teared up a few times Rating: 4.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/02/21 Average Rating: 3.9 Product Details: {'Audio languages': ['English'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]'], 'Directors': ['Vivien Lesnik Weisman'], 'Producers': ['Vivien Lesnik Weisman'], 'Starring': ['Barrett Brown', 'Jeremy Hammond'], 'Studio': ['AMC Plus Documentaries']} Review Text: Important to watch in retrospect of the Trump debacle and the QAnon disinformation/psychological campaign!
If you want to understand why Trump was elected and why QAnon and Flat earth came into being? It was in reaction to the fact that folks who were dedicated to uncovering the Truth were getting too powerful. The only way to bring the Truth movement down was to poison the well and create a fake disinfo campaign to discredit the entire REAL Truth movement.. Review Title: important to watch Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/07/23 Average Rating: 4.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Nudity', 'violence', 'alcohol use', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'Español', 'Français'], 'Directors': ['Julie Taymor'], 'Producers': ['Julie Taymor', 'Lynn Hendee'], 'Starring': ['Julianne Moore', 'Alicia Vikander', 'Timothy Hutton'], 'Studio': ['Roadside Attractions']} Review Text: I will admit, that being born in 1968 to a strong mother who was just 2-3 months older than Gloria Steinem I might be accused for taking too much for granted.

My mother got married in 1966 .. but she was already a doctor and had gone to Medical school in the 1950s when most women were becoming homemakers!. The youngest of 3, her father encouraged her to go into medicine, not nursing , like her older sister. My parents divorced in 1977 (and my father, despite his own weaknesses was a nice good man). My mother ended up raising me by herself. I had my own personal struggles growing up but feeling inferior to a boy or a man was not one of them. Both my parents loved me and gave me all they could. I didn't really identify with the "Feminist" struggle although I appreciated it intellectually. I was active in the Pro Choice movement as a right for women to control their own bodies. However, it was the more militant feminism of the 90s that unfortunately turned me away from the Feminist movement and I felt that a lot of the issues got lost among fighting over political correct speech, endlessly talking about how men are evil patriarchal rapists... So.. it was nice to return to the context on which the real women's struggle was about.

It is hard to sympathise with a woman in the United states that generally (generally) has it easy.. while in places like India... women are STILL struggling for basic dignity and respect.. Or in Afganistan where the Taliban is coming back into power to oppress once again.. or in Saudi Arabia .... and while yes, the United States is losing the battle with the Pro Choice movement..... I fear it is because women in the US have lost the path... fighting over silly things rather than critically important ones... Unfortunately it is about "branding your message" sorry to say that..

I don't demonize women who wanted to be homemakers. I think opportunties should be available for all women.. but that includes NOT being expected to take on big roles just because people like Gloria fought for that.. it wasn't JUST so all girls would desire to be president but they would also have the dignity of staying at home and raising children if that is their CHOICE... again.. it is about CHOICE and about our personal awareness of what we want, the realities of what is biologically available... as sucky that may be...

Overall, very enjoyable and inspiring. Review Title: Nice review of the woman's movement Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- === Purchase Information === Review Date: 2021/08/17 Average Rating: 3.5 Product Details: {'Content advisory': ['Violence', 'smoking', 'foul language', 'sexual content'], 'Audio languages': ['English Dialogue Boost: High', 'English', 'English [Audio Description]', 'English Dialogue Boost: Medium', 'English Dialogue Boost: Low', 'Italiano', '日本語', 'Português', 'Deutsch', 'Español (España)', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Polski', 'Čeština', 'Magyar', 'Français'], 'Subtitles': ['English [CC]', 'العربية', 'Čeština', 'Dansk', 'Deutsch', 'Ελληνικά', 'Español (Latinoamérica)', 'Español (España)', 'Suomi', 'Filipino', 'Français', 'עברית', 'हिन्दी', 'Magyar', 'Indonesia', 'Italiano', '日本語', '한국어', 'Norsk Bokmål', 'Nederlands', 'Polski', 'Português (Brasil)', 'Português (Portugal)', 'Română', 'Русский', 'Svenska', 'தமிழ்', 'తెలుగు', 'ไทย', 'Türkçe', '中文（简体）', '中文（繁體）'], 'Directors': ['Andrew Patterson'], 'Producers': ['Adam Dietrich', 'Melissa Kirkendall', 'James Montague'], 'Starring': ['Sierra McCormick', 'Jake Horowitz', 'Gail Cronauer'], 'Studio': ['Amazon Studios']} Review Text: I love this.
This film really transports you to the 1950s. Not in that flashy stereotyped way, but as though you really existed in some small town 1950s era town.
It is an intimate film.. Like something you would tell around a campfire...
The film really captures the atmosphere and ambience of the town and the era....
Reminds me of driving in a car late at night and you are listening to COAST to COAST radio.. or sitting in your bed late at night listening to the radio....

Love it. More of this kind of filmmaking please.. less over the top "special effects" that get so boring..

Great movie. Review Title: Really draws you in..... Rating: 5.0 -------------------------------------------------- Format your response exactly as follows: POSITIVE SUMMARY: [Your positive summary here] NEGATIVE SUMMARY: [Your negative summary here] OVERALL SUMMARY: [Your overall summary here]
raw_response:
POSITIVE SUMMARY:
The user demonstrates a strong appreciation for films that evoke emotion and provide thoughtful commentary. They enjoyed a quirky series set in a picturesque village, praising its humor and writing. Documentaries also resonate, with the user expressing enthusiasm for impactful issues like food waste and the importance of awareness. The user values evocative storytelling, noting a meditative film as deeply introspective and recommending it to those open to its contemplative nature. Overall, the user appreciates quality writing, emotional depth, and films that inspire personal reflection.

NEGATIVE SUMMARY:
The user has encountered dissatisfaction, particularly with productions perceived as poorly executed. They criticized certain documentaries for lacking substance, labeling them as boring interviews rather than engaging narratives. Additionally, a negative review highlighted disappointment with sloppy special effects and predictable tropes in disaster-themed films. The critiques emphasize a desire for more depth and realism in storytelling, reflecting frustration with films that fail to deliver on their potential.

OVERALL SUMMARY:
The user exhibits a diverse range of interests, favoring films that offer rich storytelling and emotional engagement. Positive experiences stem from series and documentaries that provoke thought and passion, as well as those that celebrate unique perspectives. However, the user also faces challenges with certain films, particularly those lacking in depth or falling prey to cliché. This mix of uplifting and disappointing interaction underlines a discerning taste for media that combines heart, authenticity, and a meaningful narrative.

target_interaction.title: Leaves you wanting more.
target_interaction.text: A nice reflection of an era that will never come again. This could be a number of bands from the 70s, yet it seems to me to be in the air of Fleetwood Mac. Though there's no Peter Green in the line up of characters. The story line has a nice building plot to it and waste no time to pull on the heart strings. For those who have ambitious ideas to be in the music world, I'm sure they will find it inspirational. I would imagine that by the end of the story it will have it's fans crying and cheering for more. We wait with great antici......pation.
